I suggest to make 1000 reboot with this option to find how often device started fsck to fix disk issues.
Also I found that docker images filesystem structure might be broken with kexec -e

Pavel,

I second your concern and that is the reason I am adding this option so that we could have a test script to run this test without changing installed code.

Regards,
Ying

1. "You may also want to prevent the user from ever setting the naming mode to "alias" if aliases are not present." --- I already added support for this in config/main.py. With the new code change when a user tries to change the interface_naming_mode from default to "alias", it checks the presence of "alias" entry for all ports if it fails in any one of them it return "Platform does not support alias mapping error"

2. This change is included in set_interface_naming_mode() function

2. By this way we stop user from configuring alias mode at the early stage.  This approach avoid adding additional code in other part of the scripts for "alias" check. Also, minimises the possiblity of crashes in other part of code.
Please allow me some time to test and get back to you today before merging.
Sure Nikos, will wait for your test result

Ying

Ying

can you get this into master branch?

It is for later consideration.  Since it is possible "docker exec -i swss /usr/bin/orchagent_restart_check" may fail, how to alleviate the impact on a running system?  
Possible measures:
<1> Move swss docker shutdown to the very beginning for warm reboot. If the check failed,  the whole system still runs as normal including swss. 

<2> Check retry.  The failure may be caused by some transient state, in that case a second try will likely pass, then orchagent will be frozen for warm shutdown/start. 
 #Resolved

I like the idea. Since the warm-reboot is executed with data plane running, it should recover from any failure if ever possible.
<1> Moving to beginning is not a generalized option
<2> Maybe we can 'retry' in future
<3> Maybe we can add warm recover logic in future. In this case, warm-reboot will return a non failure error code which indicated warm-reboot failed but the system is running good.

---
In reply to: [430365114](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/338#issuecomment-430365114) [](ancestors = 430365114)

> <1> Moving to beginning is not a generalized option

Could you elaborate on this?  if 
```
if [[ "$REBOOT_TYPE" = "warm-reboot" ]]; then
    # Freeze orchagent for warm restart
    docker exec -i swss /usr/bin/orchagent_restart_check || {
        echo "RESTARTCHECK failed\n" >&2
        exit 10
    }
    # Wait for orchagent processing the freezing request
    # TODO: remove waiting if we have better timing control in the above freezing command, ie. the tool
    #   send request, if orchagent not ready, it will wait till orchagent is ready and then the tool is unblocked.
    sleep 1
    # Set whole system warm reboot flag
    config warm_restart enable system
fi
```
is moved before "docker exec -i bgp killall -9 zebra",  everything else before it seems to be no-disruptive.   it doesn't affect fast-reboot.

Or, I missed something?

 #Resolved

It is not good to move. We need to kill BGP and teamd container first, make sure
1. no new fpm message goes from bgp docker to swss docker
2. ~~teamd sends out last update to swss docker, which is critical for teamd 90 seconds graceful restart.~~
3. swss processes all the significant input coming (should be required for freezing feature if not there)

then freeze swss and kill it.

By "generalized" I mean at extreme environment, all the commands are possible to fail, so moving one section of code may not solve all the problems. Currently we treat returning error code as a general solution, and users are suppose to cold reboot the switch immediately to minimize the impact.

---
In reply to: [430373946](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/338#issuecomment-430373946) [](ancestors = 430373946)

Missing a few fpm message from BGP docker is not a big issue, stopping swss after BGP docker doesn't guarantee all the pending fpm messages will be consumed by swss.

After bgp warm reboot, it will perform route reconciliation.   But failing in the middle of warm reboot is more serious,  especially considering it is avoidable for this case.  Just my personal opinion.    

Last update of teamd (lacp message) doesn't go through swss docker,  it goes to linux netdev/ASIC directly.

swss is composed of multiple processes,   internal process like neighsyncd could keep feeding orchagent.

For docker level warm restart, it is also not possible to enforce the emptiness of  the producerStateTable set. I think the best is to live with it and let the reconciliation procedure handle that.   

Move the check before all disruptive operations, and perform 1 or 2 simple retry in case of check failure.  That should filter out most cases of false alarm and leave the device in real problem there.
 #Resolved

Fixed according to @jipanyang 's suggestion.

---
In reply to: [430365114](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/338#issuecomment-430365114) [](ancestors = 430365114)

Fixed according to @jipanyang 's suggestion.

---
In reply to: [430405589](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/pull/338#issuecomment-430405589) [](ancestors = 430405589)

for indicating success or failure. i suggest this as a separate pull request in the future once we do have some indications about the return value. the current behavior is to write data into the database which can't be a failure unless the database is not there. for the other config commands, right now there's no indications towards success/failure. so i did the portchannel configurations the similar way.

In this new pull request implemented portalias feature for sonic-specific commands mentioned below:
- show pfc counters
- show queue counters
- show interface status
- show interface description
- show interface transceiver lpmode
- show interface transceiver presence
- show interface transceiver eeprom
- show lldp table
- show mac

As discussed implemented an Alias class for most of the portalias related functions. Most the above commands are in tabulated form. In function run_command_in_alias_mode else part handles above commands. Above command reusults consist of 3 parts. Header, Underline, and tabulate data. These are splitted into different categories and handled accordingly. 


```
Header------------> Adjusted spacing with the help of vendor_name_length variable
Underline---------> Introduced index variable to pick the column to be adjusted.  
Data--------------> String replace default name to alias name.
```

Is there a reason you didn't add alias-to-name conversion for the "show interfaces transceiver ..." commands? If not, please add it.

Also, please fix the merge conflict (it's only whitespace-related).

Could you also please add a new command, `show interfaces naming-mode` which displays either "default" or "alias" depending on what is currently set?

transciever support is not added due to the lack of xvcrd implemetation in Dell boxes. Since it is added recently, I can able to test with the new change.  Issue addresed in new commit.

Addressed space conflicts and added "show interface naming_mode" command support in new commit..

@qiluo-msft: The root cause was due to the lack of a "PORT" table in ConfigDB on the virtual switch. The "PORT" table will be populated by this PR: https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/2169
@paavaanan @jleveque Your commit is breaking 'show interface status', 'show platform summary' and other cmds. Alias is an optional field. See https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/issues/403

@yxieca Can you please review this PR

•	Modified the design to user based approach.   Harnessed the power of /etc/sudoers and /etc/environment file to retain the environment variable value even in sudo sessions. So, when the user request the change from default mode to alias mode, the action is completed in two phases. 
•	config/main.py script fetch the current value of IFMODE and modify as user requested alias mode and write in bashrc.
•	When the user logout and login the session bashrc update the environment variable.
•	This works for both root, and non-root sessions.

- In this latest commit, addressed review comments.
- Maintained uniformity in naming convention.
- Environement variable IFMODE  alias/default switch code is refined.

[port_alias_config.log](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-utilities/files/2174959/port_alias_config.log)

depends on https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss/pull/435

About sync. The sync command doesn't guarantee that you got your disk in sync state when the command returns. You need to wait until all disk are synced. Usually 'sleep 3' works in 90% of time.
But you can also read information about the sync operation progress here:
https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/48235/can-i-watch-the-progress-of-a-sync-operation

Thanks for pointing that out. Pavel! I added a 3 second delay after sync.

Regards,

Do not merge this please, until the requested output has been provided and the changes have received an explicit sign off by all reviewers.

We would like to request modifying 'show interface status' to include the output for 'show interfaces transceiver presence' and to not introduce 'show interfaces transceiver presence'. That way we can figure out the basic things out of one command rather than typing two. We shouldn't need to introduce 'show interfaces transceiver presence'.

@nikos-li: Requested output has been provided.

Regarding your request to include transceiver presence in the output of `show interface status`, please open an issue in this repo requesting that modification. That request will not be handled as part of this PR. We can discuss reorganizing the commands and their output in the separate issue. For now, all transceiver-related data will be found under `show interfaces transceiver` with this PR.
